intro: Aulomyrcia rufipes var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf aulomyrcia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
